Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: களவின்கண் கன்றிய காதல் விளைவின்கண்வீயா விழுமம் தரும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The eager desire of defrauding others will, when it brings forth its fruit, produce undying sorrow.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown passionately embracing a dark, shadowy figure representing the 'love of fraud' ('களவின்கண் கன்றிய காதல்'). The embrace is intense and desirous.
Layered_Composition.Midground: From this embrace, a 'fruit' is born. But it is not a normal fruit. It is a dark, thorny, pulsating seed of sorrow.
Layered_Composition.Background: This seed of sorrow rapidly grows into a monstrous, immortal thorny vine ('வீயா விழுமம்') that completely ensnares and torments the person for eternity. The initial passionate embrace has led to an inescapable, eternal torment.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The intense desire for fraudulent gain ultimately bears a fruit of undying sorrow that will torment the sinner forever.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of fraud as a dark lover is a powerful metaphor for the initial attraction to sin. The fruit of this union being an immortal, tormenting vine clearly shows the horrific and inescapable consequence.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Tragic, horrific, inescapable doom, karmic consequence.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The initial embrace is lit with a dark, passionate, seductive red. As the vine of sorrow grows, this light is choked out and replaced by a cold, terrifying, dark purple and black palette.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A narrative sequence shot, showing the transition from passionate embrace to eternal torment.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with horrifying organic GFX for the growing, tormenting vine.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: A dramatic shift from seductive, dark passion to cold, eternal despair.

Cultural_Anchors: Passionate love of fraud (களவின்கண் கன்றிய காதல்)
